intro: Gonolobus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its distinctive hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming in the morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Gonolobus pubescens is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
